author: Reuters Editorial
title: Goldman posts sharp profit drop - Reuters.com
description: Goldman Sachs' profit fell nearly 13% and missed expectations on Tuesday as a less volatile equity market hurt its trading business and dampened a bumper year for deals. Fred Katayama reports.

title: Goldman Sachs will require employees get booster shots -Bloomberg - Reuters
description: Goldman Sachs Group Inc (GS.N) will start requiring employees and visitors to its offices get booster shots of the COVID-19 vaccine starting next year, according to a report from Bloomberg.

title: Goldman Sachs expects four Fed rate hikes this year - Reuters
description: The U.S. Federal Reserve will hike interest rates four times this year and begin the runoff process for its balance sheet as soon as July, Goldman Sachs economists said.

title: Goldman appoints Sarsfield to co-run asset management unit - Bloomberg News - Reuters.com
description: Goldman Sachs Group Inc has appointed Luke Sarsfield to co-head its $1.7 trillion asset-management business, Bloomberg News reported on Sunday.

author: Reuters Staff
title: Goldman Sachs raises China property HY 2022 default rate to 19% - Reuters.com
description: Goldman Sachs said on Thursday it now expected almost a fifth of lower-rated Chinese property firms to default this year, although it could be almost a third in a more severe scenario.

author: Chibuike Oguh
title: Goldman Sachs' Petershill nears deal for Arsenal Capital stake -sources - Reuters.com
description: Petershill Partners Plc, the London-listed subsidiary of Goldman Sachs Group Inc's asset management division, is nearing a deal to acquire a stake in private equity firm Arsenal Capital Partners, people familiar with the matter said.

title: Goldman Sachs sees Brent oil hitting $100/bbl in Q3 2022 - Reuters
description: Goldman Sachs expects oil prices hitting $100 per barrel in the second half of this year, citing a lower than expected hit to demand from the Omicron coronavirus variant coupled with increased supply disruptions and OPEC+ shortfalls.

title: Goldman Sachs says bitcoin will compete with gold as "store of value" - Reuters
description: Bitcoin will take market share away from gold in 2022 as digital assets become more widely adopted, Goldman Sachs analyst Zach Pandl said in a research note to clients.
